data.title: Great  venue for so many  events
data.text: From "Masque of  the  Red Death" Halloween masquerade  ball to Craft Beer Festival, from Long Island  Medium to "The Nutcracker" ballet...anything that interests you can be found eventually at this classy locale!

data.title: Masquerade Ball
data.text: We attended the annual Halloween Masque of the Red Death Masquerade Ball this year.  It was extravagant, elegant and entertaining.  The venue is large and beautifully restored.  There is plenty of parking nearby.  It was an amazing experience .

data.title: Very Nice Decor
data.text: I was there a few months ago and I really enjoyed it. I hadn't been there in several years prior to that I love the decor!

data.title: John Mellencamp Invades Akron
data.text: Went to the concert and enjoyed it tremendously. The help staff who I believe are volunteers were outstanding. They were knowledgeable about the seating as we were seated without delay. Such a grand facility with a lot of charm and character. It is a shame that it had been a few years since we were there but we plan on making more trips there in the near future.

data.title: A crown jewel of Akron
data.text: I love experiencing the Civic!  Anything (even going through a graduation) is worth seeing there. The building and mere architecture make everything greater to see! And the moving ceiling clouds and stars have been magical to me since I was in 4th grade...and I never want to know how it happens--it's awesome!

data.title: Third Day
data.text: Went to the Civic to see Third Day. Great concert. Sat in the upper level. Could see every thing. Could hear every thing, Go back to see a concert there any time.

data.title: Experience the Theater
data.text: One of Akron's Crown Jewels! Time travel is possible; the Civic takes you back to the days when going to the Theater was an event. This landmark Marquee, to the floating clouds inside, makes any show an Event. *****

data.title: Great building
data.text: The Civic Theatre is an old building that has been remodeled. It has kept the feeling of a long ago era. It is beautiful! So worth what ever the price of the event.

data.title: Love This Theater
data.text:
The Akron Civic Theater has always been a part of my life.  Every time I go to an event there, the beauty of the theater does not cease to amaze me.  It was built in the 1920s and designed to resemble a Moorish garden.  The domed ceiling shows twinkling stars and clouds floating by.  The walls are decorated with sets depicting medieval carvings and statues.

Parking for the theater is located in the back off W. Bowery Street.  There is even a back entrance to the theater so that you do not have to walk around to the front.  However, you may want to see the front with the marvelous marquee and grand lobby depicting a Moorish castle.

If you are lucky, you will get to hear the mighty Wurlitzer organ.  The actual instruments that create the sound are hidden behind the statuary in the theater.

data.title: Long Island Medium
data.text: I was very impressed with the beauty of this theater however was not at all impressed with any of the employees there working (extremely rude, and arrogant), and then to be told we were not allowed to take any pictures of the beauty of this building, what a rip off. Also the outside of this building is a joke, looks like it needs tore down from the outside.; A few people in line were discussing this as well, we overheard them.

data.title: Steve Grand Concert
data.text: This is a cool historic theater in downtown Akron. It's beautiful in the inside and we're so glad the organization that restored and renovated it took the time and effort to revitalize it while continuing to make this city's crown jewel shine!

data.title: A must for anyone visiting Akron
data.text: I've been going to the Civic for decades. One of the best venues I've ever been to!  One of a kind architecture and atmosphere.  If you haven't been, you're missing out!!

data.title: Entertainment
data.text: Great Theater,loved the shows heard music from the 60 very entertaining! Would love to see more shows

data.title: Beautiful!
data.text: I think it's been 20 years since the last time I was at Akron Civic Theatre (I moved out of Ohio), but we were lucky enough to attend the Alice Cooper concert on September 23 and it was just phenomenal. I mean, Alice Cooper is pretty phenomenal anywhere, but this was the perfect venue. Our seats were excellent, the sound system and lighting were fantastic, the seating was comfortable, the staff did a great job of keeping people from leaving their seats to crowd the aisles, and the Civic Theatre is just as beautiful and well kept as it was the last time I was there. I may have to keep an eye on the concert schedule and plan some of my trips home to visit around concerts I want to see!

data.title: Beautiful Jewel - Civic Theatre
data.text:
I went on a tour of the theatre with the Metro Parks and was so amazed.
It is one of seven theatres left from that era (in the U.S.).  The beautiful starlight and
moving clouds make any event you attend special.  The water fountains
were made for each zodiac sign and the lobby was designed to look like
a grape arbor.  Must see to believe!

data.title: Awesome!
data.text: A purely beautiful place to be!  Very well taken care of....even down to the restrooms!  Can't wait to visit again!

data.title: Old Beauty At Its Finest !!!!
data.text:
The Amazing Architecture Of This Beauty Is Awesome
 !!!! You Can See From Ballet To Metal Bands Here !

data.title: Classy older venue
data.text: The Akron Civic Theatre has been around for as long as I can remember, I have always loved it. They keep it up and in good repair the acoustics are fantastic in this building so if you go to see a show you will be in for a treat. Don't forget to look up at the ceilings and see the beautiful artwork and vintage lighting.

data.title: Great theater for a an up close performance
data.text: I have visited the Akron Civic theater on many occasions for performances, and concerts. It is a smaller theater, seating only about 5000 people,  built in the early 1900's.  It was  beautifully renovated and upgraded in 2001.  The domed ceiling features floating stars and clouds.

data.title: The Civic Theatre is a Grand Old Lady!
data.text: The Civic is a big thrill for a first timer who may see it.  Its' architecture and attention to details make you dream about who may have passed through this theatre.  Once seated turn left and see the gigantic pipe organ and listen to its extraordinary sound.  Lean back in your seat and look up.  The ceiling takes you out-of-doors to see the night sky and the stars.  As you walk around, you will see the velvet wallpapers, and other beautiful spots.  Once upon a time, I am sure that the Civic was a destination for the well-to-do.  Go and see for yourself!
